channel.title: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct
channel.description:
I changed a lot of the typing for my server in announcements and what-not and it will not add it to my server!
I have updated java.
[code]@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java src/server/gui/*.java pause[/code]
But it will not add it at all!
The "error" is anythime i try to compile, it just says the path cannot be specified

item.title: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

omg, in need of help, pm me ur team viewer info

item.title: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct
item.dc:creator: @in_need_of_helps in need of helps
item.description:
@in_need_of_helps wrote:

I did all this but when i try to compile all i get is

The system cannot find the path specified
press any key to continue…

Read full topic
item.source: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct

item.title: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct
item.dc:creator: @demps2k9 demps2k9
item.description:
@demps2k9 wrote:

[quote=“Devinhdl, post:9, topic:406581”]Try this

[quote]@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is
about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/…
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit[/quote]

If this doesnt work, you obviously dont have a jdk :P[/quote]

All that coding is pointless for something so short.

Click Start >
Right click computer >
Choose properties >
Choose advanced system settings >
Choose Enviroment Variables >

Click new >
Variable Name = CLASSPATH
Variable Value =

OR

Click new again >
Variable Name = PATH
Variable Value =

OR

Just simply change the java to yours.

Read full topic
item.source: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct

item.title: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct
item.dc:creator: @escalation escalation
item.description:
@escalation wrote:

[quote=“Devinhdl, post:9, topic:406581”]Try this

[quote]@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is
about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/…
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit[/quote]

If this doesnt work, you obviously dont have a jdk :P[/quote]
Not exactly correct. The path could be incorrect.

item.title: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct
item.dc:creator: @Devinhdl Devinhdl
item.description:
@Devinhdl wrote:

Try this

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/... :end echo Finished! pause exit

If this doesnt work, you obviously dont have a jdk

Read full topic
item.source: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct

item.title: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct
item.dc:creator: @demps2k9 demps2k9
item.description:
@demps2k9 wrote:

Either this:

@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause

Or this:

@echo off Title Compiler "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause

Just change the java to yours. This compiler is for the packaged Project Insanity source.

Read full topic

item.title: Server won't compile! [PI] Java is correct
item.dc:creator: @escalation escalation
item.description:
@escalation wrote:

Check in you C:\ drive to see what the name of the program folder is.

E.G

Something along the lines of that. If so make the changes in the compiler to match the folder.

If that is not the case, check in your java folder to see what version your java is, could be wrong.
